item.title: French cinema actress Brigitte Bardot dies aged 91
item.description: The actress was a symbol of sexual liberation in the 1950s but became increasingly controversial after making homophobic and racist slurs.

item.title: Three killed in Sweden as major storm sweeps across Nordic countries
item.description: Thousands of homes in parts of Finland, Sweden and Norway have been left without power.

item.title: Iranian cinema giant, Bahram Beyzai, dies aged 87
item.description: A restored copy of his film, Bashu, the Little Stranger, won an award at this year's Venice Film Festival.

item.title: Executions in Iran estimated to have doubled in 2025, report says
item.description: The Iran Human Rights (IHR) group says it has verified at least 1,500 executions up until the start of December.

item.title: Nine arrested in Italy for allegedly raising millions for Hamas
item.description: Police say the suspects raised around €7m (£6m) for the militant group over more than two years.
